required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Locoregional Surgery of the Primary Tumor in de Novo Stage IV Breast Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Locoregional Surgery of the Primary Tumor in de Novo Stage IV Breast Cancer Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: Current guidelines lack definitive evidences about the relative benefits of locoregional surgery for the primary tumor in de novo stage IV breast cancer. The aim of this study (SYSBTC-001) was to investigate the role of locoregional surgery for primary tumor in de novo stage IV breast cancer.

primary_outcome.description: The association between locoregional surgery and overall survival (OS), which defined as the time from the beginning of diagnosis of breast cancer to the death with any causes.

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as time between the time of diagnosis and the time of locoregional recurrence, or death occurred.
Distant disease free survival (D-DFS), which defined as the time from the diagnosis of de novo stage IV breast cancer to the confirmed time of distant progression, or death due to any other cause.

intervention.description: Patients had pathologically confirmed operable stage IV breast infiltrating carcinoma at initial presentation, and had locoregional surgery for the breast cancer.

study_pop.textblock: Operable stage IV breast cancer patients, whose primary lesion is invasive breast cancer confirmed by pathology, and metastases can be confirmed by pathology or imaginology examination

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Operable stage IV breast cancer patients,whose primary lesion is invasive breast cancer confirmed by pathology, and metastases can be confirmed by pathology or imageology examination.
- ECOG-PS 0-2.
- Bone marrow, liver and kidney should be fully functional.
- Patients received the locoregional surgery of the primary tumor in de novo in our center, or didn't received the locoregional surgery of the primary tumor in de novo.
- For the patient who accepted systematic treatment before operation, the systematic treatment must be administered within a year since diagnosed.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Accompanied with other primary malignant tumors.
- Patients who can't plan for follow-up effectively and regularly.
- Multiple liver metastasis and ALT/AST four times higher than normal at patients' first diagnosis.

overall_official.affiliation: Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University

facility.name: Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-sen

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.keyword: In de novo stage IV brest cancer
